minimum_req: Cross-platform tool (works in Windows, Mac and Linux)
Desktop computer (e.g. optimized for wider screens)
input_data_protocols: Data entry can be fully automated programmatically (e.g. automatically run a script for multiple scenarios)
input_data_formats: Widely used file formats (CSV, JSON, XML, etc.)
output_data_formats: Widely used file formats (CSV, JSON, XML, etc.)
name: Hi-sAFe
description_brief: Hi-sAFe is a 3-D mechanistic simulation model representing tree and crop growth, taking into account light, water and nitrogen competition between trees and annual or perennial crops.
keywords: process-based model; soil-crop-tree model; mechanistic model
access_barrier: Access to the tool needs to be granted (e.g. tool owner needs to give permission after user registration; tool owner sends tool after receiving a request email)
documentation_theoretical_background_lis: Dupraz, Christian, Kevin J. Wolz, Isabelle Lecomte, Grégoire Talbot, Grégoire Vincent, Rachmat Mulia, François Bussière, et al. “Hi-sAFe: A 3D Agroforestry Model for Integrating Dynamic Tree–Crop Interactions.” Sustainability 11, no. 8 (April 16, 2019): 2293. https://doi.org/10.3390/su11082293.
feedback_tool_info: Writing complete documentation as well as tutorials in order to allow open-source publication of the model is under way... should be done by the end of 2024
